Tonight I was training one of my beginning students, and I told him not to be too 'martial-artsy'. I've said that before. But what did I mean by that? I didn't want him to inappropriately apply tension to parts of his body because he's trying to do a karate type move. I think beginners need to get gross motor coordination going; applying light force to moves and trying to get a fluidity of movement. To extend that analogy, I don't want water splashing, sometimes I want there to be gently ripples.
